name: violable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If something is violable, it is possible for people to act against it, remove it, or not respect it: These well-meaning initiatives encourage the idea that our rights are violable, turning us into a society of suspicious individuals. In linguistics, the idea of violable constraints is widely accepted.
More examplesFewer examplesThis principle is defined as a violable constraint.This suggests that phonetic realization can operate in terms of violable targets.For productivity to be possible, morphological rules must be violable.Books are merely objects: they are inert and violable.
